alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 10:09PM CDT until August 26 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Phillips and Smith. Portions of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Franklin, Furnas and Harlan. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that minor flooding is likely still ongoing in parts of the Advisory area, due to between 1 and 3 inches of rain that fell earlier Friday evening. The vast majority of rain has ended for the night, but an additional one-quarter to one-half inch cannot be ruled out at some point overnight. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Walnut Creek, Medicine Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Prairie Dog Creek, East Big Creek, Plum Creek, Turkey Creek, East Plum Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, West Beaver Creek, West Cedar Creek, West Big Creek, West Middle Cedar Creek, Sappa Creek, West Plum Creek, Plotner Creek, Bow Creek. - Some locations that could still experience flooding include... Phillipsburg, Alma, Franklin, Kensington, Agra, Kirwin, Republican City, Long Island, Prairie View, Naponee, Bloomington, Glade, Athol, Speed, Cedar, Harlan County Dam and Woodruff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
